definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
dried meat/private teacher's remuneration/withered/variant of 修[xiu1]
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
Tang dynasty compendium of herbal medicine

sentences.english: Their farm set up a pumping station this year.
sentences.chinese: 他们农场今年新修了一个抽水站。

sentences.english: As we drove into your community, I also noticed that you have built a new road in your village.
sentences.chinese: 当我们刚才走进村子时，我也发现村里新修了道路。

sentences.english: Drainage pipes and gutters are being installed.
sentences.chinese: 公路上还新修了排水管道和边沟。

sentences.english: Several houses were pulled down to make way for the new road.
sentences.chinese: 为了给新修的道路让路，几座房屋被拆毁了。

sentences.english: This new road meets a long-felt need.
sentences.chinese: 这条新修的路满足了大家长期以来感到的需要。

sentences.english: A new small park just beside of the Zhujiang River.
sentences.chinese: 江边新修的一个小公园，花坛的造型简直完美。

sentences.english: But the new parking and stuff is good.
sentences.chinese: 但新修的停车场和其他设施都很棒。

sentences.english: The interpretation of the law and ineffectiveness of the revised law are continually mentioned by bloggers.
sentences.chinese: 部落客持续讨论法律的诠释与新修广播法的无效。

sentences.english: Hundreds of miles of new roads and rail track are speeding uptransport.
sentences.chinese: 数百英里的新修道路和铁轨加快了运输效率。

definition: to repair/to refurbish/to renovate/to refit/to mend/to rebuild
old and in a state of disrepair (idiom)/dilapidated
Xinjian county in Nanchang 南昌, Jiangxi
